Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2007 12:37PM righarm06 wrote: I developed lymphedema after my surgery in Nov. 05.  I went to therapist 3 times already.  I've learned to massage and wrap my arm, told losing weight might help, I'm working on the weight part.  My lymphedema isn't under control despite wearing daytime and nightime sleeve.  Heat definitely affects it.  When arm is full of fluid it feels heavy.  I'm a new user to this site from Eutawville, SC.
Posts.Title: Does lymphedema ever improve? 3boys4me ahdjdbcjdjdbkf

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2007 09:51PM righarm06 wrote: I was told to wear my sleeve and could rake for 30 minutes, but if I last for 5 to 10 minutes I'm lucky.  My arm becomes very tired, hurts, feels very heavy.  Retired school teacher would like to get part-time job, but my lymphedema is so out of control right now, arm is constantly heavy, full, and tingling.  I wear my daytime and nightime garments about 22 to 24 hours a day.
Posts.Title: Raking leaves Chloe68 righarm06
